item.title: Getting Started With InnerSource
item.description: InnerSource, the powerful movement for developing open source software within the walls of a single organization, where the “openness” of a project extends across teams inside the company. Author Andy Oram takes you inside InnerSource, first by reviewing the principles that make open source development successful, and then by describing how InnerSource has worked at PayPal.

item.title: Introducing the Trusted Committer Role
item.description: The Trusted Committer (TC) role is one of the key roles in an InnerSource community. Think of Trusted Committers as the people in a community that you trust with important technical decisions and with mentoring contributors to ultimately get contributions over the finish line.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: The Contributor in InnerSource Have you ever been blocked in your next coding task because another team didn’t have time to add a feature in their system that you depend on?

item.title: Introduction
item.description: This Learning Path gives an introduction to InnerSource. InnerSource is the application of open source practices and principles to software development within the enterprise.

item.title: Becoming an InnerSource Contributor
item.description: InnerSource contributors operate outside of regular team boundaries, they are the links crossing organisational silos. As such, they need to be aware of a few common practices that make this work more effective.

item.title: Ensuring Product Quality
item.description: Let’s start with the responsibility most often associated with the Trusted Committer role: ensuring product quality.

item.title: How Difficult it is to be Middle Management
Understanding the InnerSource Checklist
item.description: Author Silona Bonewald explains how the InnerSource initiative can help your company develop software internally by applying lessons from the open source movement. A checklist guides you through various steps needed to produce software using the InnerSource approach, whether it’s company wide or just for one team.

item.title: What problems does InnerSource solve?
item.description: InnerSource encourages and rewards collaboration and code reuse with anyone, regardless of their position in a company’s organizational structure.

item.title: Contributor Ethos
item.description: In the last segment we have outlined why you would want to reuse components and become active as a Contributor.

item.title: How does InnerSource work?
item.description: Let’s say that team A uses software produced by team B. Team A submits a feature request to team B, but team B isn’t able to implement that feature in time for team A.

item.title: Keeping the Community Healthy
item.description: The introduction pointed out that Trusted Committers have both tech-oriented and community-oriented responsibilities. It is not sufficient to focus on code and code health only.

item.title: Major Benefits are Built into the InnerSource Process
Managing InnerSource Projects
item.description: How to manage InnerSource projects? In this book Daniel Izquierdo & José Manrique López explain basic infrastructure as well as metrics that are helpful when introducing InnerSource methodologies into an enterprise.

item.title: Adopting InnerSource
item.description: Danese Cooper and Klaas-Jan Stol present a series of case studies at a range of companies to show when and why InnerSource may be useful to your organization. The case studies candidly discuss the difficulties of getting InnerSource projects started, along with the progress so far and the benefits or negative fallout.

item.title: Mechanics of contributing
item.description: Are you ready to start contributing to other teams projects/repos? Do you look forward to reducing your blockers not by management escalation but by collaboration?

item.title: State of InnerSource Survey 2016
item.description: Report of the 2016 State of InnerSource Survey

item.title: State of InnerSource Survey 2020
item.description: Report of the 2020 State of InnerSource Survey

item.title: State of InnerSource Survey 2021
item.description: We need your help. Share your insights with us in the State of InnerSource Survey 2021.

item.title: Upleveling Community Members
item.description: There is a continuum of participation in an InnerSource community. There are people who are not aware of the community.

item.title: What are the benefits of InnerSource?
item.description: There are many benefits to collaborating via InnerSource. InnerSource gives a company a scalable strategy for guest teams to get feature requests when they need them without the long-term burden of maintenance.

item.title: Benefits of becoming an InnerSource Contributor
item.description: Contributors are the life blood of InnerSource projects. Every project that is run as an InnerSource project comes both with the promise and with the ultimate goal of expanding their development team beyond the original founders, tapping into the potential of further collaborators amongst users (also sometimes referred to as customers in corporations) of that project.

item.title: InnerSource Patterns
item.description: A Pattern - That’s what we call InnerSource best practices codified in a specific format to make it easy to understand, evaluate, and apply them in your context. This book contains the most mature patterns, collected by the InnerSource Commons Community.

item.title: InnerSource principles
item.description: Every company, team, project, and individual is different. Because of that fact, the exact way that the concept of InnerSource works will vary from one situation to another.

item.title: Lowering the Barriers to Entry
item.description: Soliciting contributions in an InnerSource community is more challenging than it is in an Open Source community for a number of reasons:

item.title: Advocating for the Community’s Needs
item.description: InnerSource communities exist in a corporate context and are thus more constrained than Open Source communities.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: Thanks for reviewing the Contributor segment of the InnerSource Commons Learning Path. With this section you’ve learned about the Contributor role - the life blood of InnerSource projects.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: In this learning path, we’ve given an introduction to InnerSource. InnerSource applies open source best practices and principles to internal software development.

item.title: Becoming a Trusted Committer
item.description: The Trusted Committer role is a demanding but fulfilling role. If this learning path interests you, you might be wondering how to actually become a Trusted Committer and if you are the right person for the job.

item.title: Workbook
item.description: Video: InnerSource Contributor SEGMENT: Becoming an InnerSource Contributor TIP: More than one answer may be correct in some questions.

item.title: Workbook
item.description: Video: Introduction to InnerSource SEGMENT: What Problems Does InnerSource Solve? TIP: More than one answer may be correct in some questions.

item.title: Workbook
item.description: Video: InnerSource Product Owners SEGMENT: How Difficult It Is to Be Middle Management TIP: More than one answer may be correct in some questions.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: In the previous chapters we have learned about the responsibilities of Trusted Committers. Some of these responsibilities include ensuring product quality, keeping their community healthy, reducing the barriers to making contributions, upleveling the community and advocating for its needs within the organization.

item.title: Workbook
item.description: Video: The Trusted Committer Role in InnerSource SEGMENT: Introduction Question 1. What sentence best describes the motivation for the name “Trusted Committer”?

item.title: InnerSource Programs & People Strategies
item.description: Join us for our first InnerSource Community Call of 2022 where we will discuss the topic of InnerSource Programs & People Strategies.

item.title: 2021 Year End Call
item.description: Join us for our Year End InnerSource Commons Community Call to connect and celebrate a great year past and agree on priorities for 2022.

item.title: InnerSource Commons Outstanding Contributors 2021
item.description: The Internet, November 19th, 2021 2021 has been a significant year for InnerSource Commons. With over 50 active contributors across the 3 working groups, the community has significantly increased its activity and achieved some amazing results.

item.title: InnerSource Summit 2021
item.description: 17th and 18th November 2021, online Get your ticket now! Join us at the world’s largest InnerSource Conference!

item.title: Strategies for Kick-starting InnerSource
item.description: Join us for an InnerSource Commons Community Call where we will discuss Strategies to Kick-start InnerSource in enterprise organizations with Jesús Alonso Gutierrez from Grupo Santander and Shishir Saxena from Fidelity.

item.title: Clare Dillon Joins InnerSource Commons as First Executive Director
item.description: The Internet, October 19th, 2021 The InnerSource Commons Foundation (ISC), the world’s foremost community for InnerSource practitioners, today announced Clare Dillon as Executive Director.

item.title: InnerSource Patterns
item.description: Join us for an InnerSource Commons Community Call where we will discuss the topic of InnerSource Patterns with Gil Yehuda from US Bank, Fei Wan from Comcast and Sebastian Spier from Meltwater.

item.title: InnerSource Commons announces first Partners and Supporters helping to scale the efforts in creating and sharing InnerSource knowledge
item.description: The Internet, September 22, 2021 InnerSource Commons, the world’s largest community of InnerSource practitioners, today announced seven new Partners and Supporters at the launch of their new Sponsorship Program.

item.title: InnerSource in the Enterprise
item.description: Join us for an InnerSource Commons Community Call where we will discuss the topic of InnerSource in the Enterprise - Stories from National Australia Bank and Huawei with Matt Cobby and Willem Jiang.

item.title: InnerSource in Action
item.description: Join us for an InnerSource Commons Community Call where we will discuss the topic of InnerSource in Action with Georg Grütter from Bosch and Isabel Drost-Fromm from Europace.

item.title: InnerSource & Discoverability
item.description: Join us for an InnerSource Commons Community Call where we will discuss the topic of InnerSource & Discoverability with Michael Graf and Guilherme Delagustin from SAP.

item.title: InnerSource & DevOps
item.description: In this session we will be joined by Fei Wan from Comcast, Steph Egan from BBC and Tom Sadler from BBC who will be sharing their experiences of implementing DevOps with InnerSource.

item.title: InnerSource in Government
item.description: In this session we will be joined by Zack Koppert from GitHub and some of the InnerSource Community, who will be sharing their experiences of how to implement InnerSource in government organizations.

item.title: InnerSource Metrics, Value & ROI Community Call
item.description: In this session we will be joined by Joe Patrao from Bloomberg and Daniel Izquierdo from Bitergia, who will be sharing their experiences of how to measure the success of your InnerSource implementation.

item.title: InnerSource Commons Joins FINOS
item.description: InnerSource Commons to Further Collaboration Within Fintech Organizations We are delighted that to announce that InnerSource Commons is now an associate member of FINOS, the Fintech Open Source Foundation.

item.title: InnerSource Commons announces the appointment of a new Board of Directors
item.description: The InnerSource Commons Foundation is delighted to announce the election of a new Board of Directors comprising of Danese Cooper (Chairperson), Isabel Drost-Fromm (President), Georg Grutter (Vice President), Cedric Williams (Treasurer), Russell Rutledge (Secretary), Johannes Tigges (Assistant Secretary), Maximilian Capraro, Daniel Izquierdo Cortazar and Jacob Green.

item.title: APAC Virtual Summit 2020
item.description: 2nd and 3rd December 2020, online - event site! The 12th InnerSource Commons Summit was our first summit timed for our growing APAC community.

item.title: Statement of Support of the EC Adoption of InnerSource
item.description: The InnerSource Commons welcomes the European Commission’s new Open Source Software Strategy 2020-2023 highlighting how InnerSource (the creation of working cultures based on open source) is an integral part of a robust open source strategy and ecosystem.

item.title: North American Fall Virtual Summit 2020
item.description: 15th and 16th September 2020, online! The 11th InnerSource Commons Summit stayed online thanks to the success of the ISC Online Spring Summit 2020.

item.title: Spring Summit 2020
item.description: 14th to 15th April 2020, online The 10th InnerSource Commons Summit took place in your living room!

item.title: Incorporation of InnerSource Commons Foundation
item.description: Press Release: Incorporation of InnerSource Commons Foundation The InnerSource Commons Foundation (ISC) was incorporated on February 19th, 2020 and is taking steps to become a 501(c)(3) public charity.

item.title: Fall Summit 2019
item.description: MossLabs.io, St. Francis Neighborhood Center, Maryland Institute College of Art, & The Johns Hopkins University proudly welcome the InnerSource Commons community to Baltimore.

item.title: InnerSource Day @ OSCON 2019
item.description: InnerSource day at OSCON is a gathering of industry practitioners discussing real-world implementations of this community-inspired, transformational open source approach to software development within the enterprise.

item.title: Spring Summit 2019
item.description: 9th to 11th April 2019 in Galway, Ireland Follow us on Twitter and Facebook and share your experience of the Summit.

item.title: Fall Summit 2018
item.description: October 3-5, 2018 in Islandia, New York, USA Event That’s an official wrap on the InnerSource Commons Fall Summit!

item.title: Spring Summit 2018
item.description: May 16-18 Wed-Fri near Stuttgart, Germany Pictures and Videos The ISC.S6 is a wrap! Thanks to all attendees for making this summit such an engaging and interesting one!

item.title: Fall Summit 2017
item.description: September 27-29 Wed-Fri in Chicago (Naperville, IL), USA Fifty nine people representing twenty two companies and institutions were present for the InnerSource Commons Fall Summit 2017 in Naperville, IL, USA.

item.title: Spring Summit 2017
item.description: April 18-20 in Geneva, Switzerland Join us for the next InnerSource Commons Summit in Geneva, Switzerland.

item.title: Fall Summit 2016
item.description: September 28-30 in Boston, USA Join us for the next InnerSource Commons Summit in Boston, USA.

item.title: InnerSource @ OSCON US 2016
item.description: May 16-19 in Austin, Texas There are several opportunities to learn more about InnerSource at OSCON US this year.

item.title: Spring Summit 2016
item.description: April 21-22 2016 in London, England Companies today already understand that Open Source is necessary.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: The quickest and best way to reach us is to join Slack and ask your question in the #general channel.

item.title: InnerSource Commons Code of Conduct
item.description: Our Pledge We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

item.title: InnerSource in Action
item.description: “ We’re moving towards more openness, which ultimately creates a communication culture and a generative culture, rather than one that’s bureaucratic and process-based.

item.title: Members
item.description: The InnerSource Commons (ISC) community is open to all. Some community participants go above and beyond, and may be invited to become an ISC Member.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: InnerSource Commons is an independent non-for-profit organisation that creates and shares knowledge about InnerSource for its members.
